title: Would you stop a mother from screaming at her child?
text: Share this article Share But, several pedestrians did step in and had conversations with our mother. Some even shared a hug with her when they had finished. Ms Driver said: The experiment was very raw on people's emotions because, obviously, it's an innocent child. I've had one woman completely sob on me, and another woman was just left crying, so when you say it's not real, they are just relieved.' Cathy Ranson, editor of ChannelMum.com, said: 'This powerful video shows no matter how busy our society, there are still strangers kind enough to care about a struggling young mum and her child.' 'It takes a whole village to raise a child - and that village includes you. If you see a parent in distress, don't walk on by but offer help. Even if they don't take it, they'll be reassured someone cared enough to offer it.' Would you step in or just carry on walking? This gentleman stops to see if the 'mother' needs any assistance, as she appears to be losing control Another woman stops to make sure if our 'woman' is okay during out social experiment This women stopped and spoke to our 'mother' for a long time before the pair shared an emotional embrace 'I thought something must be wrong. She looked distressed,' said the woman pictured left. The man, right, added: 'We got concerned she might have thought that the baby might be dead' Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
